page.title: 01The Village of Ash.
page.content: The parish of Ash is situated at the extreme west of the county of Surrey. Together, Ash, Ash Vale and Ash Green form the largest village in England. The long ridge of chalk known as the Hog's Back lies southward and carries the A.31 London to Winchester. Ash is surrounded by sandy heathland and woods of silver birch and fir. Much of this heathland is used by the Army for its Firing Ranges. Many of the Army personnel based at Aldershot 2 miles away live in Ash. The Basingstoke Canal runs through the village and is being restored. A Water Sports Centre has been opened in the disused gravel pits and now provides a large recreation area. Ash has some fine old buildings including two mentioned in the Domesday book - Ash Manor and St Peter's Church.
